name: Hackerz Drone
description: Warning: the target ship is programmed to engage in self-defense behaviors to ensure a realistic simulation.

name: Akousnikis
description: The Akousnikis is a composite freighter constructed from the salvaged wreckage of a Akoustiki and a pair of Sonikis. Despite being smaller than an Avlaki, its compact design has made it both tougher and more difficult to hit.

name: Avlakinos
description: Bolting two additional cargo pods to the front of an Avlaki resulted in a variant known as the Avlakinos. The additional weight is most noticeable when the cargo pods are full. 	Although this modification is reversible, captains who have gone through the process rarely change their minds later.

name: Modified Frequentia
description: The discovery of Gossamer caused many to look at the Frequentia-class freighter as the optimal choice for hauling the fish found there. But the lack of any weapon mounts to harvest them proved to be an obstacle to this purpose. 	With your Avgi Harvester license, and a modest markup to cover labor costs, the shipyard is willing to add a single turret mount to solve this issue.

name: Phonikos
description: The Phonikos is a composite interceptor constructed from the salvaged wreckage of a Photikon and a Sonikis. Enough space to accomodate a single pilot remains after disposing of the wrecked computers and redundant equipment. 	Despite the dangers imposed by the Incursion, there are Avgi willing to pilot a fragile vessel such as this for the freedom it provides to visit other worlds. This has made it a popular starter ship for Dissonant pirates.

name: Sonikikis
description: The Sonikikis is a larger sized Utility Drone that requires the use of a fighter bay to house it. This has limited it to a niche role in deep space mining operations. Offering double the cargo space of a Sonikis, it can be slow when carrying a full load. 	Fighters do not come equipped with a hyperdrive. You cannot carry a fighter unless you have a ship in your fleet with a fighter bay.

name: Tremoferos
description: The Tremoferos is a composite Frigate constructed from the salvaged wreckage of a Tremoros and an Interferos. Enough space to accomodate a small crew remains after disposing of the wrecked computers and redundant equipment.

name: Interlari
description: The Interlari is a composite Frigate constructed from the salvaged wreckage of an Interferos and a Polari. A new experimental Lamina is installed on it...

name: Poloptikon
description: The Poloptikon is a composite Scout constructed from the salvaged wreckage of a Polari and two Optikons. A new experimental Lamina is installed on it...

name: Polipolari
description: The Polipolari is a composite Scout constructed from the salvaged wreckage of two Polaris. A new experimental Lamina is installed on it...

name: Kimek Bramble
description: The Bramble is a recent addition to Kimek fleets, giving them a viable option for transporting large amounts of time sensitive freight.

name: Saryd Trailblazer
description: The Trailblazer is the ancient warship Coalition shipyards are referring to during their sales pitch for the Sojourner. These relics of war are no longer in production. Of the few known to still exist, most are kept as display pieces in private collections. It is a rare sight to see one in actual use.

name: Worldcrusher
description: The first vessel of its kind; and the last.

name: Crystal Sentry
description: This Crystal Sentry is still has some functionality.

name: Astero Nautilus
description: The Astero Nautilus lurk amongst the asteroids of Pebble Beach. Their rock-like shells are hardened from centuries of consuming the minerals in the surrounding asteroids.

name: Corpse Trickster
description: Although it lacks the ability to travel through Hyperspace on its own, these parasitic predators evolved a means to control the bodily functions of a dead Subsidurial by thrusting its tentacles into the nervous system of the corpse. After doing so, it is able to use the Subsidurial's ability to traverse across Hyperspace. 	Corpse Tricksters also have the ability to create hypnotic illusions, though the means by which it accomplishes this are a mystery. A favored tactic is creating an image of a Subsidurial to lure a fresh host. Alternatively, it might make multiple images of itself to intimidate and confuse other predators.

name: Corpse Trickster Body
description: A dead Subsidurial. The head is missing, but the body has been infused with chemicals that keeps it somewhat functional.

name: Gray Eye
description: Gray Eyes are very old Subsidurials that have developed thicker hides. They have also learned how to make a powerful slap with their tails. While they still retain the peaceful disposition of their younger siblings, Gray Eyes are often vindictive when attacked.

name: Ionic Leech
description: These creatures have infested the Northern Passage since before humans colonized the north. They crave the power generated by ships and are somehow able to consume it through the use of organs uniquely evolved for the task. While they're a rare sight, captains who have the misfortune of encountering them will find that they attack in large swarms.

name: Luminazoa
description: The exposed mantle of Hell's Maw is home to a thriving colony of these creatures. While they are content to harmlessly scavenge for minerals, they can become dangerous when provoked. Their tendrils are able to emit electrical bursts which can disrupt a ship's power systems.

name: Murkcap
description: This fungal colony lurks within the dark waters of Murk. The danger of the spores it sprays out isn't immediately obvious.

name: Murkpod
description: The mold propagates...

name: Rock Scavenger
description: Rock Scavengers look fearsome, but they are actually quite passive if left alone. Unfortunately they are often hunted for their meat, which is considered a delicacy on the Paradise planets.

name: Plasma Parasite
description: While these creatures are neither aggressive nor malicious, the Heliarchs consider them a nuisance. They are attracted to the exhaust emissions of starship engines and will swarm over a ship. Unfortunately 90% of their bodies consist of volatile plasma, causing them to explode violently when exposed to weapons fire.

name: Nova Firefly
description: An invasive species from beyond our galaxy. These creatures thrive in the super heated gasses of dissipating supernovas. Through an unknown process, they are able to produce a fiery burst of their own flames.

name: Egg Pouch
description: A fleshy pouch containing Nova Firefly eggs. The pouch protects and nourishes the eggs while they float through the void between galaxies.

name: Firefly Young
description: A freshly hatched Nova Firely. They have not yet developed their parent's territorial hostility or their ability to vomit bursts of flame.

name: Star Gazer
description: An invasive species from beyond our galaxy. They seem possessed by an insatiable curiosity, observing everything they encounter with multiple eyes and other, more alien, sensory organs. While not particularly aggressive, Stargazers can be dangerous if provoked. Their bodies are covered with sharp quills that can be flung towards predators. They regenerate quickly, allowing them to maintain a constant stream of fire. These projectiles are made of a material that evades detection by anti-missile systems and may have other unknown properties.

name: Liquid Metal
description: While this is technically an artificial life form, it is indigenous to our galaxy.

name: Subsidurial Titan
description: Some Subsidurials can grow to titanic sizes if given abundant food and a lack of predators.

name: Unstable Wormhole
description: These wormholes are too small for anything larger than a drone to fly through. The aperture is unstable and may shift locations, or collapse entirely, at any moment. The few drones that do make it through seem to have their programming scrambled, perhaps a result of the strange bolts of energy surrounding the phenomenon.

name: Hyperspace Anomaly
description: A phenomenon consisting of small tears in the fabric of reality briefly connecting normal space with hyperspace. The existence of these anomalies may provide some hint regarding the nature of wormholes and their creation.

name: Genesis Spacecraft
description: A basic space exploration vessel from a pre-hyperdrive civilization. The hull lacks any form of shield emitter and doesn't have the internal safety protocols found on the ships of more advanced species. But it does seem sturdier than the hull of an equivalently sized human ship.

name: Genesis Logistic
description: The inhabitants of Genesis developed this ship to supply their nearby space colonies. It has enough weaponry to contribute to defense operations as well.

name: Genesis Probe
description: The inhabitants of Genesis developed this probe to study the area beyond their solar system.

name: Genesis Transport
description: The inhabitants of Genesis developed these transports to ferry civilians to their nearby space colonies.

name: Genesis Cryoship
description: The inhabitants of Genesis developed these ships with a Cryogenic Hub built directly into the hull. It also provides enough outfit and cargo space to support the use of massive numbers of Cryostasis Pods. With this they hope to extend their reach beyond their solar system.

name: Armor Beetle
description: The Armor Beetle is a specialized Unfettered warship that has been optimized for combat at the expense of cargo space.

name: Horseshoe Crab
description: An old fossil abandoned by modern Hai, many functional Horseshoe Crabs can still be found on their ancestral worlds. While somewhat sluggish compared to to the Lightning Bug, its hardened defenses and additional turret mount make it a formidable alternative.

name: Millipede
description: During the ancient Hai empire, Millipedes operated as troop transports. When the empire fell into decline, Millipedes transported refugees from the ruined Hai worlds to the Hai civilizations current location. Once the Hai settled down, there was no longer a need for such a massive transport ship. Few Millipedes remain today. The ones still in operation are mostly used by the Unfettered as boarding vessels.

name: Megalocoleus
description: The Megalocoleus was a siege engine. The ancient Hai could simply station one at an enemy world until the natives surrendered due to the blockade. Unfortunately, it is not a fast ship and the majority of them were abandoned when the Hai fled their ancestral home.

name: Modified Aphid
description: The Unfettered sometimes modify Aphids to make them more suitable for combat. This Modified Aphid has sacrificed a fuel tank for additional shield emitters and heavier hull plating. Significant portions of its cargo bay have also been dedicated to weapons systems to support an additional gun port.

name: Questing Tick
description: The Questing Tick is a sturdy interceptor that was once a common sight in the ancient Hai empire. Now, they are almost exclusively used by the Unfettered.

name: Sword Scorpion
description: When the Unfettered were creating new prototype warships, the Sword Scorpion was one of the candidates. Initial tests yielded promising results. However, after seeing the Giftbringer in action, the Unfettered settled on a rival prototype that would eventually become the Solifuge.

name: Titan Beetle
description: Excelling at both transportation and logistics, the Titan Beetle is more versatile than the Shield Beetle in every aspect but combat. A key component of this are the built-in collection gills which magnify the natural ramscoop present in all ships and large capacity fuel tanks that facilitated uninterrupted travel to far-flung regions of the Hai empire.

name: Asteroid Defense
description: A Modified Blaster Turret bolted onto an asteroid. The automated firing system isn't very accurate.

name: Battle Barge
description: From a distance, this looks like a bulk freighter or container transport. But the Battle Barge is a pirate war ship. What might be mistaken for cargo bays are actually twelve armored battle stations. Each one is capable of mounting a turret for offense or defense, making this ship a formidable mobile weapons platform.

name: Beacon Drone
description: Beacon Drones are designed to accommodate a powerful Spotlight for the purpose of drawing attention to hostile ships and other threats. They were specifically deployed to supplement security in the Paradise worlds, but Navy officers in frontier regions have expressed interest in adding them to their fleets. 	Drones do not come equipped with a hyperdrive. You cannot carry a drone unless you have a ship in your fleet with a drone bay.

name: Broadsword
description: Long ago, a captain asked the head shipwright of Grendel Station to add an external fighter bay to the original Saber's hull. It didn't take long before the shipyard extended this modification with a second bay to create the Broadsword. This design is most commonly found in remote pirate systems on the outer rim.

name: Buckler
description: Built upon a Dagger chassis, the Buckler plays a very different combat role from its smaller sibling. Lacking any weapon mounts, it features a high number of shield emitters and some of the toughest hull armor of any interceptor in the galaxy. 	Buckler pilots are expected to prioritize the defense of the flagship they are meant to protect over their own safety. To encourage this, new Bucklers purchased from Lionheart include a free training video installed on the ship's computer. Mixed in with tutorials for operating and maintaining the spacecraft are inspirational stories praising heroic pilots who sacrificed themselves for the greater good.

name: Cannikin
description: The Cannikin is an ancient gaslining ship designed to detect and harvest deuterium from gas giants. Despite being slower and heavier than a Star Barge, some merchant fleets use them as supplentary fuel tankers. 	This ship is capable of diving into the harsh atmosphere of a gas giant.

name: Deuterium Tanker
description: Deuterium Tankers are slow and difficult to maneuver ships. They supply spaceports with hyperspace fuel from deuterium refineries. The vital service provided by them are an important element in the galactic economy that is rarely acknowledged. 	Inexperienced or foolish pirates sometimes mistake a Deuterium Tanker for a regular freighter with disastrous results. The contents of their high capacity fuel tanks creates a fiery hazard when the ship explodes, burning any ships caught in the blast. 	This ship has some resistance to fuel leaks.

name: Gremlin
description: Betelgeuse Shipyards Gremlin has seen limited adoption among merchant fleets. It has become especially popular among smugglers, who've created alternative configurations using Interference Plating.

name: Midnight Hauler VI
description: After a series of delays due to unfortunate events in the testing phase, the Hauler VI is finally available for purchase. There were rumors that an innovative new refrigerated storage system was being developed for it. But no such system is present in the final production model.

name: Heavy Enforcer
description: The Heavy Enforcers used by Dirtbelt pirates have their engines upgraded to offset the increased weight from adding heavy armor plating and extra shield emitters.

name: Heavy Freighter
description: The Freighter is designed by the Syndicate to be an efficient means of carrying cargo from system to system, but is so slow and difficult to land that most pilots hate flying them. 	The Heavy Freighter, with its increased cargo capacity, is more durable and better defended than the regular Syndicate Freighter. But this makes it an even slower and less maneuverable ship.

name: Light Freighter
description: The Syndicate's Light Freighter is a surprisingly affordable and versatile upgrade from the Star Barge. Unfortunately, many shipyards that are supposed to carry it have trouble keeping it in stock due to high demand.

name: Longsword
description: The Longsword is the result of the Saber's evolution among Dirtbelt pirates. The two additional gun ports on the ship's aft section are primarily used for the purpose of adding long range missiles.

name: Mega Freighter
description: The Syndicate's Mega Freighter is being marketed as a symbol for a new era of peace and prosperity in the post-war galaxy. Despite having double the cargo capacity of a Container Transport, the empty hull isn't much heavier unless it's carrying a full cargo load. In addition to the extra cargo space, this ship offers more flexibility for installing engines, weapons, and other outfits.

name: Missileboat
description: For centuries, the Missileboat provided fleet admirals with a reliable artillery unit to support their front line vessels. The outdated systems interface on this ship have a higher crew requirement than the Rainmaker currently used by the Navy. Retired Missileboats are sometimes used by bounty hunters. 	This ship is exclusively offered as surplus inventory at the Geminus shipyards. If any are found for sale elsewhere, they were probably stolen.

name: Outrider
description: The Navy Outrider interceptor was decommissioned with the rise of the Navy Carrier. But after the bombing of Geminus saw the Navy's ability to construct new capital ships hindered, the Republic has requested production of the Outrider be resumed to support their fleets. 	No Navy license is required to purchase this ship. It was previously made available to the public via the surplus ship sales program on Geminus.

name: Palisade
description: The largest in a series of ships the Syndicate promoted as an affordable mass transport solution, Palisades are well protected by heavy hull plating and massive shield emitters.

name: Parapet
description: Prioritizing quantity over quality, the Parapet formed the baseline for a series of ships the Syndicate promoted as an affordable mass transport solution.

name: Patrolboat
description: The Patrolboat is an old ship that previously performed the role which the modern Gunboat fulfills. The main reason the Navy replaced it was the lack of a turret mount. Some retired Patrolboats have found a new role as merchant escorts or bounty hunters. 	This ship is exclusively offered as surplus inventory at the Geminus shipyards. If any are found for sale elsewhere, they were probably stolen.

name: Pirate Drone
description: Locals started making these in their backyard garages to satisfy a limited demand for unofficial combat drones. From a distance, it looks like someone duct taped an energy blaster to the side of a civilian science drone. Upon closer inspection, that assessment isn't too far off. Each drone has minor differences in construction materials and how the wires are routed. Few pirates actually use these, but the ones who do tend to buy them in bulk.

name: Rampart
description: The second in a series of ships the Syndicate promoted as an affordable mass transport solution, the Rampart is sturdier than its smaller counterpart.

name: Rancor
description: The Rancor was originally a pirate vessel, and many were used in the early turf wars. The Alpha War was the beginning of the Rancor's decline as faster interceptors quickly outpaced and outmaneuvered this relatively slower ship. Today it is seen as a relic of the past, most noteworthy for influencing the design of the Fury.

name: Scrounger
description: Assembled from the burned out remains of wrecked freighters, Scroungers are how some pilots lacking the funds for better options begin their careers. Unfortunately, it is not uncommon for those facing financial desperation to turn to small scale acts of piracy, scavenging parts and cargo from the scraps leftover by larger raiders.

name: Shuttle Pod
description: Shuttle Pods were multipurpose light spacecraft that early exploration ships could carry in their fighter bays. While it is no longer in production, a multitude were made. Many are still in use throughout the galaxy despite their antiquated design. 	This particular Shuttle Pod configuration was the standard for transporting cargo and mining, but other configurations were used as well.

name: Star King
description: To celebrate a new era of peace in galactic history, Betelgeuse has brought the Star King back into production. An even larger luxury liner than their distinguished Star Queen, this vessel offers its passengers all of the high end amenities that wealthy travelers would expect from its smaller counterpart.

name: Starbus
description: A major component to their Hauler freighters, Southbound's Starbus heavy shuttle can sacrifice mobility for increased armaments. 	When tensions arose between the Free Worlds and Republic, Southbound Shipyards brought the Starbus heavy shuttle back into production.

name: Starcadia
description: The technology on the Starcadia, while in line with other modern ships, is surprisingly mundane for a newly deployed ship from the Deep. This has caused some to speculate that the Deep has lost their edge in technological advancement. Alternatively, conspiracy theorists suggest that the Deep has been sitting on this design for some time and is only releasing it now in preparation for some threat unknown to the general public. Deep Security, for its part, has no comment on these rumors.

name: Stingray
description: With an empty hull weighing in at 180 tons, Megaparsec's Stingray is among the heaviest interceptors in the galaxy. They were once deployed by Syndicate security forces to escort freighter convoys and patrol trade routes, but the Syndicate has since replaced it with the more economically friendly Wasp. 	While some Stingrays can still be found protecting private merchant fleets or mining asteroids, many have found their way into the hands of pirates.

name: Striker Drone
description: Southbound Shipyards and Kraz Cybernetics hastily constructed this modified Surveillance Drone at the request of the Free Worlds. With barely enough weapon space to install anything larger than a small missile pod, the Striker drone can provide long distance fire support or aid in surprise tactical strikes.

name: Sunracer
description: The ship of choice for most professional racing pilots. With a focus on maximizing speed, a Sunracer lacks space to spare for ubiquitous things like cargo, bunks, weapons, or a hyperdrive. 	These ships serve a unique niche and are exclusively sold at inflated prices on the planet they're named after. Although it's possible to squeeze one into a fighter bay, the prohibitive cost and minimal combat capability means there isn't a compelling reason to use them in that capacity.

name: Amalgam
description: This experimental model quicksilver has been created using Korath nanotechnology found in the north. In addition to added flexibility in the assignment of oufit space, it gives the hull the ability to regenerate itself.

name: Antique Sunder
description: Most of these older model Sunders have been upgraded by the Covert Mining Cartel into the Plunder. This has made them increasingly scarce...

name: Carabao
description: An alternative to the Bactrian, the Carabao suffered from unpopularity due to its reliance on drones and automated systems. To this day urban legends spread horror stories of the ship's systems going haywire, resulting in grisly and gruesome deaths for the unfortunate colonists who chose to rely on such a vessel for their journey.

name: Executive Guard
description: Featuring luxury accommodations and cutting edge Syndicate technology, the Executive Guard is reserved for the exclusive use of Syndicate VIPs.

name: Hipparion
description: The Hipparion was an exploration vessel used in the early days of hyperspace travel. City ships often followed the paths mapped out by explorers who preceded them in ships like this one. It has been suggested that the Mule was created as a more economically viable successor to this antiquated design.

name: Infiltrator
description: Featuring integrated scanning interference and jamming technologies, this is a specialized Scout used by Republic Intelligence operatives for espionage missions. They have rarely been seen in public, leading some to speculate that this ship doesn't actually exist and is nothing more than an urban legend.

name: Kestrel Prototype
description: This prototype Kestrel was stolen from the Tarazed shipyards. Despite inferior stats compared to the mass production model, it is still an excellent ship.

name: Liberator
description: The Liberator is a new warship that was originally designed by Southbound Shipyards to replace the Skein. Rumor has it that the project scope shifted focus during development when a ship of alien origin was discovered at the edges of the Rim. As a result, the planned fighter bays were scrapped in favor of the concentrated fire mount. This design crams all of the ship's gun ports into a single central location, allowing multiple smaller guns to emulate the effect of having a single larger one. This negatively impacts the ship's cooling efficiency and increases the amount of work maintenance crews have to put in for guns not mounted on the edge of the firing cluster.

name: Mastodon
description: Everyone who has a city ship license knows what the Mastodon looks like. Its image is the one pictured on the license. Mastodons were the first city ships equipped with a hyperdrive. Prior to that, colonists relied on generational ships or cryo ships. Only one Mastodon is still listed in active service on the Republic's official ship registry.

name: Parade Float
description: This is a vessel specifically made for promotional marketing of a product or service. An ad agency will typically contract with an escort to take the ship on a tour of several nearby systems to promote the product or service.

name: Plexus
description: The Plexus is a new warship that was originally designed by Southbound Shipyards to replace the Skein. There were rumors that an alternative design substituting the fighter launch bay with a massive gun mount was being considered. But if that were true, it's no surprise that the carrier version won out. Cynical observers of starship sales trends often mention that selling carriers gives Southbound a steady market for replacement fighters.

name: Plunder
description: This ship is exclusively for sale to certain members of the Covert Mining Cartel. The Plunder is often mistaken for a modification of the Sunder currently sold by Syndicate Shipyards. But its lineage can be traced back to an older model that ceased production long ago. 	This confusion is exacerbated by the fact that the Plunder is indeed missing two of its original external cargo pods. However, these pods were located in the ship's undercarriage. Their removal allowed installation of a second drone bay. Unlike the second drone on the Syndicate's Sunder, this one faces forward, allowing it to quickly target the Plunder's prey.

name: Hacker Drone
description: A civilian science drone. Some have been taken over by hackers and repurposed for abusing the cargo scan fining system.

name: Shield Fortress
description: Captain Arnold Benedict had this monster custom made with help from Marauder tinkerers. They pieced it together from the salvaged wreckage of an alien ship and a Navy Carrier.

name: Star Explorer
description: An ancient space exploration vessel from the early days of Hyperspace travel. Many claim the Star Explorer's design was heavily influenced by an old Earth science-fiction show as a marketing gimmick to entice young people to leave Sol and risk their lives exploring the vast unknown. Of the few that haven't been lost or destroyed, there are some still being used as actual science and exploration vessels. The rest are held in private collections by fans of antiquities.

name: Strategos
description: The Strategos is a super carrier, able to transport additional fighters and drones. Navy strategists intend for it to serve as a mobile headquarters in the frontier regions of the Republic.

name: Enforcer Drone
description: The Navy Enforcer Drone is a new design meant to accompany the Strategos super carriers. It adds enough space for an additional beam laser and some simple shield emitters.

name: Subsidurius
description: This unique ship was created by a maniac obsessed with grandiose delusions of Subsidurial domination.

name: War Hauler
description: A leftover from the Alpha Wars, War Hauler production stopped soon after the wars ended. Although the ship predates the Republic and is not manufactured by any modern shipyards, Parliament still passed a law prohibiting retail sales of this ship to ordinary civilians. This has made the few remaining War Haulers on the secondary market a highly sought after item amongst collectors of antique ships.

name: Metropolis
description: Among the largest models of all city ships, a Metropolis is formed through the combination of three smaller utility ships. An emergency separation feature is supposed to allow the three ships to act independently. However, that feature is currently malfunctioning with this particular Metropolis ship. Perhaps one day, you will find an engineer who can figure out how to unfreeze the binding clamps without destroying the ship in the process.

name: District
description: The District ship comprises the aft portion of a Metropolis ship. It features the most outfit and cargo space of the three sections as well as the most weapons support. While it does not have a proper fighter bay, a small landing pad on the roof is outfitted with a docking port and clamps, allowing a support fighter to latch onto its back.

name: Prefecture
description: The Prefecture comprises the center portion of a Metropolis ship. It includes two fighter bays along with a good portion of cargo and outfit space. Four turrets provide a platform for offensive weaponry.

name: Municipality
description: The Municipality comprises the forward section of a Metropolis ship. It is the only section with forward firing gun ports. However, it has the least cargo and outfit space of the three sections. Special sensor equipment was integrated into the foremost part of the ship to aid in planetary exploration and mapping. One of its two fighter bays was modified to host a pair of drones.

name: Marauder Argosy
description: What was once a simple Argosy is buried beneath thick plates of additional armored hull plating and shield emitters. Reconfigured gun ports, expanded engine space, and a drone bay leave little room for cargo in this medium warship.

name: Marauder Barb
description: Wrecked Barbs tend to come in two flavors: the gun or the cockpit. Putting the gun to use is a simple matter, but preventing the cockpit from going to waste was a bit more complicated. Someone decided that welding it onto the side of an intact Barb could convert it into a deceptively lightweight short range interceptor.

name: Marauder Bastion
description: Someone converted this Southbound Shipyards Bastion into a durable gunship at the cost of minimizing its cargo space. Significantly more crew are also required to operate some its customized systems.

name: Marauder Behemoth
description: This Betelgeuse Shipyards Behemoth has had extensive modifications applied to its hull and cargo hold. Notable are the two fighter bays that leave no doubt that this former freighter is now a warship.

name: Marauder Carrier
description: A captured Carrier under the control of pirates is unthinkable. It is more likely that this ship was reconstructed using parts salvaged from wreckage left behind during battles between the Republic and Free Worlds.

name: Marauder Cruiser
description: On extremely rare occasions, a Republic Cruiser will be captured by pirates. Rarer still are Cruisers held by pirates who have evaded the Navy long enough to make extensive modifications to the hull.

name: Marauder Frigate
description: The Frigate has been in use for centuries. During that time, more than a few have been captured by pirates and undergone significant alterations.

name: Marauder Osprey
description: This Tarazed Osprey has been reinforced with additional hull plating and shielding. However, it is still best suited as a light, fast striking, warship.

name: Marauder Hauler
description: Some Haulers are modified to reduce mass and drag by replacing the standard cargo container with something smaller. The previous owner of this Hauler took the standard Southbound Shipyards cargo container and cut it down to half its size.

name: Marauder Protector
description: The previous owner of this Syndicate Shipyards Protector made some adjustments to its weapons capacity. Combined with additional hull plating and shielding, the result is a floating fortress than can handle threats from any direction.

name: Marauder Sparrow
description: At first glance this ship doesn't seem to be much different from a normal Sparrow. But the smooth exterior hides an explosive secret within.

name: Marauder Vanguard
description: This Syndicate Shipyards Vanguard has been customized with additional armored plating as well as upgraded shielding to accommodate the latest experimental technologies.

name: Marauder Wasp
description: Sacrificing quantity for quality, the owner of this Wasp has reduced the number of gun ports for more weapon space, thicker hull plating, and more shield emitters.

name: Modified Aerie
description: The fighter bays on this Aerie have been replaced with additional gun ports. With the weapon systems rerouted from the central turret mount to accomodate the new guns, its combat role has shifted to that of a gun ship.

name: Modified Barb
description: Some pirates have modified the Barb by removing the turret mount to focus on its ability to install a large gun or missile launcher while making extra engine space for improved speed and maneuverability. 	Fighters do not come equipped with a hyperdrive. You cannot carry a fighter unless you have a ship in your fleet with a fighter bay.

name: Modified Berserker
description: This Berserker was salvaged from a war zone. Its weapons layout is different from the standard Berserker. The weapons pods on the wingtips have been converted into cargo space while a gun has been installed in the ship's forward section.

name: Modified Buckler
description: Modified Bucklers are short range interceptors that have had much of their fuel capacity removed to make room for some light weaponry. These ships aren't recommended for first time pilots. All the technical and maintenance documentation has been deleted from the on-board computer to make room for weapon system targeting software.

name: Modified Clipper
description: Some captains have modified their Clippers so much that the hull seems ready to fall apart. Despite the constant need for repairs and maintenance, many believe the increased customization is worth it.

name: Modified Enforcer
description: After centuries of service, some ancient warships have undergone significant modifications to make them more suitable for civilian use. The removal of the turrent mount to allow for more cargo space has effectively turned this Modified Enforcer into a freighter.

name: Modified Firebird
description: This is a Firebird that has been heavily modified for use as a freighter. The weapon capacity has been severely downgraded in order to accommodate more cargo. One of the turret mounts has even been completely removed.

name: Modified Hauler
description: The cargo container on this Modified Hauler has been reconfigured to carry a fighter. Unwary Merchants can be caught off-guard by pirates using a ship like this.

name: Modified Hauler II
description: Both cargo containers on this Modified Hauler have been reconfigured to carry fighters. Unwary Merchants can be caught off-guard by pirates using a ship like this.

name: Modified Hauler III
description: All the cargo containers on this Modified Hauler III have been reconfigured to carry fighters. Unwary Merchants can be caught off-guard by pirates using a ship like this.

name: Modified Hogshead
description: Occasionally a pirate gets the idea in his head to adapt a ship not designed for warfare into a pirate vessel. Oftentimes the results weren't worth the effort. But some of these attempts manage to find a niche. A Modified Hogshead might appear under the command of bounty hunters or slavers who are likely to find a ship of this type useful in their line of work. 	Over half the passenger space on this Hogshead has been gutted to make room for more shield emitters and weapon systems to power the two additional gun ports. Thick armored plating has been welded over the passenger viewports and other vulnerable areas of the hull, making the ship heavier, but more durable.

name: Modified Nest
description: It's no secret that pilots find the fighter bays on a nest inconvenient to access. The previous owner of this Nest attempted to fix this issue by modifying the fighter bays to accommodate drones instead.

name: Modified Quicksilver
description: As the Quicksilver ages, modified variants of it are becoming more commonplace. It is not uncommon for the original design's raw power to be sacrificed in exchange for increased versatility.

name: Modified Roost
description: The rise of civilian drone use amongst pirates has had unforeseen developments. This Roost is just one example of that. The previous owner had the fighter bays modified to accommodate drones instead.

name: Modified Saber
description: There have been many attempts to modernize the Saber. As more Sabers undergo modifications, the the original unmodified Saber becomes even more scarce.

name: Modified Skein
description: It's very rare for a pirate to capture a Skein. It is even more rare to find one that has been modified to carry drones instead.

name: Thermopylae Station
description: A prototype built before the war that was never actually deployed into active service. 	The Asteroid Catapult installed on it was supposed to be securely locked away in a Navy testing facility.

name: Titania Station
description: Titania Station is a deuterium refinery near Earth. It is owned and operated by the Syndicate.

name: Phoenix Station
description: Phoenix Station is a refinery in the Deep. It gets notoriously hot when it's not hidden within the shadow of the planet it orbits. A skeleton crew manages the station while most of the manual labor is done by androids.

name: Triton Station
description: Triton Station is a Republic garrison in the North.

name: Fenrir Station
description: Fenrir Station is a refinery in the Deep.

name: Typhon Station
description: Typhon Station is a fuel refinery in the Rim owned by Southbound Shipyards.

name: Oberon Station
description: Oberon Station is a deuterium refinery in the Core. It is owned and operated by the Syndicate.

name: Leviathan Station
description: Leviathan Station is a government owned deuterium harvesting station is the Deep.

name: Wyvern Station
description: Wyvern Station is a waypoint station in the Rim. The structure is old but sound.

name: Carbuncle Station
description: Carbuncle Station is a research facility in the North owned by Lovelace Labs.

name: Kraken Station
description: Kraken Station is an old deuterium refinery near Earth. The station has been modified and repaired so often that not a single part of the original station remains.

name: Arachne Station
description: Arachne Station in the South is privately owned by Tarazed Corporation.

name: Muninn Station
description: Muninn Station is used as a military base in the Deep.

name: Hydra Station
description: Hydra Station is a run-down deuterium refinery in the Dirt belt. It is in constant need of repair.

name: Charon Station
description: Charon Station is an overcrowded refueling station in the South.

name: Smuggler's Den
description: Smuggler's Den has access to fenced goods from beyond the region.

name: Huginn Station
description: Huginn Station is a prison outpost in the Deep.

name: Charybdis Station
description: Charybdis Station is a massive deuterium refinery in the Core privately owned by the Syndicate.

name: Veliante'ixis
description: Most Builder ships were destroyed by the Ka'het. Concealed for millennia under the ocean waves of Retilie, this warship survived the invasion. It was found by Lu Bu during the Grave Digger's exploration of the Graveyard. Lu Bu never completed salvage operations, but a few former Grave Diggers knew of the derelict's location.

name: Kai'xeris
description: Designed to haul cargo over short distances, the Kai'xeris is one of the few Builder ships not destroyed by the Ka'het. 	This ship is capable of diving into the harsh atmosphere of a gas giant.

name: Kai'teris
description: Designed to ferry passengers over short distances, the Kai'teris is one of the few Builder ships not destroyed by the Ka'het. 	This ship is capable of diving into the harsh atmosphere of a gas giant.

name: Rao'xeris
description: A deep space mining vessel, the Rao'xeris was used to transport materials harvested in the northern reaches of Builder space to processing facilities in the southern region. When the Ka'het invasion began, many found that it could easily be converted into a capable warship. 	This ship is capable of diving into the harsh atmosphere of a gas giant.

name: Ool'mar
description: Featuring the Builders best ramscoop technology with integrated fuel stabilizers and storage tanks, the Ool'mar was specifically designed for the purpose of harvesting and transporting hyperspace fuel. With the collapse of the Builder civilization, there was no longer any need to harvest fuel. Most Ool'mar can be found wandering aimlessly, unable to off load the contents of their fuel tanks because Builder stations lack the capacity to accept their cargo. 	Drones do not come equipped with a hyperdrive. You cannot carry a drone unless you have a ship in your fleet with a drone bay. 	This ship is capable of diving into the harsh atmosphere of a gas giant.

name: Veliante'exis
description: This is the only Builder ship that hasn't been completely destroyed by the Ka'het. Concealed for millennia under the ocean waves of Retilie, it was found by Lu Bu during the Grave Digger's exploration of the Graveyard. Lu Bu never completed salvage operations, but a few former Grave Diggers knew of the derelict's location. The ship's original outfits couldn't be salvaged. The Grave Diggers have replaced them with Ka'het outfits.

name: Ancient Raider
description: An old alien ship that was stolen from a Syndicate Shipyards lab.

name: Akfir A'awoj
description: The largest of Korath production vessels are derived from a common and ancient chassis. This utility vessel was converted into a warship early in the Korath civil war, but was quickly outclassed as the war intensified. It is named after a world that vanished from Korath space. Nir Akfir may still exist in the territory of another species. If it does, they probably refer to it by a different name.

name: Far'itar
description: Dedicated cargo transports are no longer necessary among the Korath Exiles. Rather than being scrapped, these ships have been repurposed to serve as mobile prisons. Criminals convicted of serious crimes are given a choice between a quick death via a microbot nutrigel processor or a life long assignment working on a Far'itar mining vessel. Prisoners who fail to perform their duties are still eligible for being tossed into the nutrigel processor. 	Operating these vessels can be lucrative for its captains, but the Korath authorities require them to activate their self destruct in the event of a mutiny or other event that could result in a prisoner escape. Whether or not they have the fortitude to fulfill this duty is put to the test whenever they engage in a boarding battle.

name: Kar'iyar
description: The Kar'iyar is a lightly armed fighter transport ship. They primarily serve as escorts to supplement the fire power of larger Korath fleets.

name: Kor Explorer
description: Ecks Pel'ores are exploration vessels deployed by the Korath for deep space exploration. They were specifically designed to be able to escape the harsh gravitional forces of Sagittarius A*.

name: Sa'ifar
description: A Sa'ifar houses a multitude of samples representing all natural life that could be salvaged from Korath worlds before they were ruined by the war. The crews operating these vessels fervently hope that their preservation efforts will one day contribute to the restoration of their ancient worlds.

name: Tch'esar
description: Tch'esar warships are no longer regarded as suitable for serious combat. However, they are still a capable platform for some of the Korath's heavier guns. The few which haven't been dismantled for scrap are utilized as patrol vessels and escorts to bolster the Korath home defense fleets.

name: Pug Karota
description: The Karot is a small escort fighter for Pug ships that have the bays to carry them.

name: Pug Paragon Zibruka
description: The Zibruka is the smallest Pug warship that you know of. It is a fearsome ship to face off against, especially in swarms. 	The Paragon variant of the Zibruka is intended for battles rated tier 2 and above. It has increased shielding and a reinforced hull. It also adds a turret mount and the additional space to use it.

name: Pug Paragon Enfolta
description: The Enfolta is a medium-sized Pug warship. A single Enfolta can take on multiple smaller human ships. 	The Paragon variant of the Enfolta is intended for battles rated tier 2 and above. It has increased shielding and a reinforced hull. It also adds one more turret mount with the additional space to use it.

name: Pug Paragon Maboro
description: The Maboro appears to be the Pug's capital warship. It is a ship that only the strongest human capital ships are able to oppose. 	The Paragon variant of the Marboro is intended for battles rated tier 2 and above. It has increased shielding and a reinforced hull. It also adds two more turret mounts with the additional space to use them.

name: Marauder Kestrel
description: Several years ago, while visiting a sweat lodge in search of spiritual renewal, Tarazed's chief ship designer fell into a trance and journeyed to a reality separate from our own. There he saw visions of a strange and elegant starship. Returning to his work with renewed purpose, he spent the next seven years making the Kestrel a reality.

name: Quarg Ouroboros
description: The Ouroboros is a long haul freighter for carrying supplies between Quarg ring worlds and their more distant planets. Ouroboros crews tend to serve on the same ship for centuries and are the Quarg most likely to have visited every region of the galaxy.

name: Quarg Tiamat
description: A heavy freighter with expanded capabilities, the Tiamat fulfills the role of a utility ship that can perform a variety of missions. On deep space excursions they often serve as a core support ship for more specialized vessels that might have difficulty operating far from Quarg territory.

name: Quarg Basilisk
description: The Basilisk was a blockade runner during a time when the Quarg's ringworlds were under siege from an unexpected threat. Over a thousand years have passed since then. During that time, the ship has been repurposed into a scouting vessel. 	The cloaking technology is built into the Basilisk's hull; it cannot be removed or transferred to another ship.

name: Quarg Zilant
description: The Zilant is a fast assault ship used to harass and break enemy fleet formations or make quick strikes on targets behind enemy lines. In more peaceful regions of the galaxy, they are relegated to simple patrol and escort duties.

name: Quarg Orochi
description: The mythical Orochi was defeated by enticing it to drink itself into a stupor. These powerful ships are slow to deploy due to their low fuel capacity. Rarely are they seen outside of Quarg planetary defense fleets.

name: Quarg Cockatrice
description: The Cockatrice is a small fighter that can provide supplementary defense to their planets or Quarg ships with the bays to carry them.

name: Quarg Gorgon
description: The Gorgon was used by the Quarg as a freighter. It is an older design from a bygone era, bearing heavy armaments for its role while lacking some of the structural support developments found in more modern Quarg freighters.

name: Quarg Skycrane
description: Based on a heavy freighter frame with expanded capabilities, the Skycrane is a utility ship used by the Quarg for a variety of purposes.

name: Quarg Skythrush
description: The Skythrush was designed to be used as a blockade runner. Over a thousand years have passed since anyone has dared lay siege to the Quarg, shifting their role towards cargo support and scouting.

name: Quarg Warkite
description: The Warkite is a nimble assault ship used by the Quarg to harass and break enemy fleet formations or make quick surgical strikes against targets behind enemy lines.

name: Quarg Warwyrm
description: The Warwyrm is used by the Quarg as a heavy warship. Slow to deploy due to their low fuel capacity, they are rarely seen outside of their planetary defense fleets.

name: Quarg Skyshrew
description: The Skyshrew is a fighter that can provide fire support to Quarg ships with the bays to carry them. An array of essential non-weapon systems are built into the hull.

name: Ember Nightmare
description: An abomination constructed by adding the salvaged remains of destroyed Remnant ships to what was originally an Albatross. Beelzebub has had this ship since abandoning the Remnant in pursuit of his own fortunes amongst the pirates of the ancestral humans.

name: Modified Bactrian
description: The owner of this Bactrian has replaced some of it's armored hull plating with additional shield emitters. This has made the ship lighter and faster. An additional fighter can be carried on a landing pad on the roof.

name: Nightingale
description: The Nightingale is a drone developed for long-term survillance over the uninhabited systems of the Ember Waste. They are fragile constructs built more for stealth than combat.

name: Prefect's Albatross
description: Once they left human space, it became apparent to the Remnant that they would need to build their own shipyards in order to defend themselves if they were discovered by the Alphas or any other unfriendly faction. Using new composite materials that they discovered, they built ships very different from anything seen in human space. The wings of this Albatross sweep back, giving it a sleek appearance. This marks it as a Prefect's Albatross, used on the rare occasion when a Prefect isn't riding on a cloaked ship.

name: Raptor Prototype
description: The Raptor Prototype is the result of experiments utilizing biological specimens collected from across the galaxy and beyond. As a result, its design is a bit different from other Remnant ships.

name: Shrike
description: The Shrike is a nimble gunship that is usually outfitted to provide long distance fire support. Remnant captains embarking on solo missions might opt for a more aggressive outfit selection instead.

name: Wren
description: Thanks to its cloaking technology, the Wren provides discreet transportation to remote Remnant research outposts. 	The cloaking technology is built into the Wren's hull; it cannot be removed or transferred to another ship.

name: Shadow Falcon
description: This Tarazed Falcon has had some modifications done. The hull has no enhancements to shields, engines, or weapons. But it does have built in radar jamming, scan interference, and enhanced heat dissipation. Whoever designed this seemed to be intent on creating a stealth warship.

name: Shadow Hawk
description: This Tarazed Hawk has had some modifications done. The hull has no enhancements to shields, engines, or weapons. But it does have built in radar jamming, scan interference, and enhanced heat dissipation. Whoever designed this seemed to be intent on creating a stealth warship.

name: Shadow Osprey
description: This Tarazed Osprey has had some modifications done. The hull has no enhancements to shields, engines, or weapons. But it does have built in radar jamming, scan interference, and enhanced heat dissipation. Whoever designed this seemed to be intent on creating a stealth interceptor.

name: Shadow Raven
description: This Lionheart Raven has had some modifications done. The hull has no enhancements to shields, engines, or weapons. But it does have built in radar jamming, scan interference, and enhanced heat dissipation. Whoever designed this seemed to be intent on creating a stealth warship.

name: Sapphire Shield
description: Discovered by Dr. Wesley Stumpernickle, associate archaologist at Alexandria. Shortly after its discovery, the ship went on tour in the Paradise worlds, giving many people their first opportunity to see an alien vessel up close.

name: Ruby Dagger
description: A lightly armed escort ship used by the Sheragi to accompany their cargo and transport fleets.

name: Diamondback
description: Diamondbacks have been in use since explorers first settled the galactic rim. They've fought in various wars throughout the centuries and few survive to this day. Those that have are so extensively customized that no two are alike. Some southern legends claim the Diamondbacks were wrecked spacecraft created by extinct aliens and salvaged by early explorers such as Han Sizer. There is no evidence to support these claims and no reputable scholar takes them seriously.

name: Kvelqde-Sosrue
description: This Kvelqde variant is designed to optimize the use of "Myiara" Fire Spouts. There are whispers that those who pilot such vessels are patron servants of a secret House that manipulates events from the shadows. Within the respectable echelons of Successor society such tales are dismissed as mere superstition, no more real than the monster from a children's poem. 	This ship can install Predecessor Multimode Armor materials.

name: Stolsaqra-Sosrue
description: This variant Stolsaqra is a test model developed by Shadow House. Like the Kvelqde-Sosrue, it is designed to accomodate a pair of "Myiara" Fire Spouts into its arsenal. 	This ship can install Predecessor Multimode Armor materials.

name: Ojde-Sado
description: The remnants of House Sado constructed this Ojde from more durable materials than the standard model. Other elements of its design have been reconfigured for combat. Notably, much of its cargo bay has been altered to service a pair of fighters. 	This ship can mount High House Multimodal Armor configurations. With an adaptor, it can also utilize Predecessor Multimode Armor materials.

name: Kvelqde-Kiitaa
description: Many of the features of this Kvelqde have been scaled back, allowing it to be carried within a fighter bay without compromising its durability.

name: Deep River Carrier
description: This is a Deep River freighter that has had some of its cargo container mounts modified to carry drones.

name: Storm Seeker
description: An old relic from a time when the Wanderers occupied what is now southern human space, the Storm Seeker is a security patrol ship with an array of information warfare technologies built directly into the hull.

name: Shallow Pond
description: These ancient Wanderer interceptors can deploy a drone for added versatility in combat.

name: Spring Leaf
description: This ancient Wanderer transport was among the ships originally in use when they first arrived in our galaxy. Now, obsolete, the Spring Leaf is best suited for display in a museum.

name: Winter Leaf
description: With the Unfettered Hai behind them and the unknown beyond the Eye ahead, Wanderer shipyards are prepared to phase out production of the Summer Leaf in favor of this ancient alternative.

name: Tornado
description: An ancient Wanderer warship, the Tornado was likely used to fulfill the same role as the modern Tempest. There are many similarities between the two ships.

name: Tsunami
description: The Tsunami is a mobile fortress. Among the ancient Wanderer vessels, it was their closest equivalent to a city-ship.

name: Deep River Rapids
description: This is a Deep River freighter that has been converted into a war ship.

name: Thunder Maker
description: An ancient Wanderer planetary defense system.
